intro: Herpetospermum pedunculosum, commonly known as the red-flowered hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate with a smooth surface and are arranged alternately along the stem. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by birds and insects.
